entries.meaning: (programming, countable) A program that reads source code written in assembly language and produces executable machine code, possibly together with information needed by linkers, debuggers and other tools.
examples: The system includes an 8080 and a Z80 assembler, a Tektronix format downloader and other utilities.

entries.meaning: (computer languages, informal, chiefly uncountable) Assembly language.
examples: I wrote that program in assembler.
Our father worked as an assembler in a radio factory that would go out of business in the early 1960s,  […]

entries.meaning: (nanotechnology, countable) A nanodevice capable of assembling nanodevices, possibly including copies of itself, according to a plan.
